Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Stephen P
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel last minute and I do think I received quite a bargain. The room was very comfortable with ample wardrobe space for my short stay (probably fine for a few nights for two). The decor took me by surprise with the walls actually being upholstered but it all seemed to work very well. The bathroom was nice and clean and everything worked. The shower is extremely powerful so if you have small children, make sure you turn on the taps very slowly so it's not too strong for them. With the shower that strong, no curtain did mean a lot of water splashing out of the bath, but there were ample towels to dry myself and the floor. With the window shut, the room was very quiet indeed and the only noises I'd hear would be the occasional front door of other rooms on my floor, but no voices etc. Being in the centre of a city, if you open the window, you will hear the traffic! As for the pro's of the location, it was very easy to get to - 2 metro lines serve it (one direct to CDG Airport, the other straight to the Louvre) within 5mins walk. I didn't have any food there, so can't comment on breakfast. Lift access is small, so could be difficult with a large party, or large bags. Staff are friendly and helpful enough. I didn't have any particular need to ask anything out of the ordinary, but I can say they all speak good English when my French got stuck. I'd certainly consider staying here again, particularly if I managed a similar last minute deal. I'd recommend it for anyone able-bodied for single or doubly occupied rooms. Can't comment on family accommodation as I only needed the room for me! p.s. some of the 'guest photos' on this site show some rather nasty bathroom pictures - they're clearly not bathrooms from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only adequate”
Reviews.Author: funtravelwithfamily
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, but rooms are quite small, and the hotel was hot. Room size really OK by Paris standards, though. Breakfast was just average. There is no computer to print boarding passes, check travel details, etc. The hotel is close to some cafes, but they had to call a taxi when we needed it as it was not on a major route.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised on the upside”
Reviews.Author: Triper98021175
Reviews.Content: I hunted high and low online for days, looking for an apartment for 4 adults and a baby. I booked this one, not certain about the quality of the accommodation. We had 2 rooms which shared an entrance, then had separate doors. The rooms had recently been renovated to a very high standard. They had made such an effort with the baby cot too. The staff were all very friendly. Main issues: Lift tiny, stairs not lit well, shower leaked onto bathroom floor (common in most hotels) Everything else: great - though didn't have the breakfast. It's about a 20 min walk to the Lourve. Overall I was very impressed and would def stay here again. I consider myself fussy. Just remember to manually turn the radiator off at night if you don't want to cook!

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom and Elevator Issues”
Reviews.Author: jackpot8160
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, nearby is the 7 line (Censer Daubenton Station) and the 21 and 27 buses stops on the corner of the hotel. Many restaurants are in walking distance as well as a reasonable priced shopping area. They have WiFi and provide a lap top in the bar area for your use. The continental breakfast consists of juices, coffee, tea, pastries, processed meats, cereals and fresh fruits. The staff is pleasant and offers assistance readily; however, the housekeeping staff leaves alot to be desired. I brought a washcloth because non are provided in European hotels and it was taken and not returned. Next time I will take a colored one. The hotel has one elevator which I got struck in for about 5 minutes. It can only accommodate 2 persons with luggage. One morning, the water stopped running for about 20 minutes because something happened. Not clear about what. If you are an older person, ask for a room with a step in shower instead of a tub. The tubs are extremely high and difficult to get into. They have no hand rails and the tub in my room leaked. All the rooms are small, but it appears that the rooms on the front of the hotel are larger then the ones in the back. The size didn't bother me because I just slept there and the mattress was very comfortable. The phones are very interesting to use within the hotel and only on my last day there did I finally learn how to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Room way too small”
Reviews.Author: FayeSpark
Reviews.Content: We've stayed cities before so you never expect a large room but this was ridiculous. There was barely enough room to shuffle past one side of the double bed and to close the bathroom door you had to squeeze against the sink. We complained as soon as we arrived and were told that all the rooms were the same size. We booked this last year at a rate of 189 Euros per night for a superior room and noticed that on the desk they had a rate of 295 Euros. We felt ripped off even at our discounted rate. Otherwise the hotel was fine. The staff were polite and the room was clean and fresh. They were good enough to store our luggage for 2 days while we went to Bayeux which was a big help.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hcvoyageuse
Reviews.Content: Very charming feel - quaint with upholstered walls and matching bedding. The lobby and breakfast room are both very charming as well. Delicious French breakfast. Some Americans may feel some of the rooms/bathrooms are too small, as did some of our participants. But it is an authentically Parisian hotel - I call it charm! No two rooms are alike! Very well located.. at most a 5-minute walk to the Rue Mouffetard area where there is a great pedestrian street, and on some days an open-air market. Convenient to the Censier-Daubenton metro stop. Despite the business-like nature of the staff (do not expect warmth, but also they are not rude) I always enjoy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hot as Hell”
Reviews.Author: MattHurst2
Reviews.Content: It was unseasonably warm in Paris but hotel staff insisted A/C worked. It did not . I am not sure if I was most upset with heat or staffs lies.

Reviews.Title: “ok for Paris”
Reviews.Author: tripsTorino
Reviews.Content: Nice location in 5th. Prices very high but compared to other location in Paris, possible. Familiar hospitality, with good and bad in a 3 stars rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor quality exspensive rooms”
Reviews.Author: AwesomeDan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in a touristy location but is only a 5 min walk from metro. Also it is easily reached from C de Gualle airport on the B line RER train. The restaurants on the walk to the metro station are great and at least 10Euros cheaper than in central paris so thats' the good stuff. Bad stuff - 1st stay - bathroom door handle fell off so you couldn't open the door. We has to change rooms. 2nd stay - We had an 'renovated room'? Though this room had a fantastic bed it had no curtains, no tv (It had been removed), no shelves or coat hangers and no where to hang towels. I would look for another hotel in the same area if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but rooms are small.”
Reviews.Author: JustinWind
Reviews.Content: First the positives: quiet, non-busy section of Paris just outside the Latin Quarter; close to metro/RER stops, nice area; clean room with nice beds and a very, very polite and helpful staff. Negatives: Rooms are small with little storage space; don't be fooled by "TRIPLE" room designation, this just means a double bed with a cot next to it; also absolutely no moving room in a triple. All in all this hotel was good, b/c if you're in Paris to stay in the hotel all day then you're not here for the right reasons. The breakfast was good and all of the staff was fantastic. The rooms are small though as apparently all Paris hotel rooms are, probably overpriced, but everything in Paris is. Try the Italian restaurant closest to the hotel, it's FABULOUS.

Reviews.Title: “Do not use this hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveler068
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at much better B.W. hotels in Paris before. However, this time we needed a triple room since our 18 year old granddaughter was traveling with us. The beds for a triple room were very small but could make do. The biggest problem we had was that the air conditioning went out in the hotel on Saturday and nothing was done to repair until during the day on Monday. Two very sleepless nights due to the heat. When the outside temperature is in high 80's you expect to come into a comfortable hotel. That did not happen. The person on the front desk during the day, Valerie, was less than friendly and even rude at times. I have heard this about French people but had not experienced it until this trip. They would not even compensate us for the two nights without air conditioning. Some parts of this stay were very good like free internet and wonderful breakfast. Over all, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Touring. Not finished yet though.”
Reviews.Author: Snoozeedog
Reviews.Content: Visited this Hotel for a 3 day trip with my 82 year old Mother. The Hotel is Small but very pleasent, but our room was still in the middle of being renovated, so we had no TV, Phone, Curtains and holes where the Wall lights will be. Once it is finished it will be lovely, but i would check that your room is finished before booking. Great location, within a 15 minute walk to Park de Luxembourg and 25 mins to Notre Dame. Great Bus Route on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, though don't expect a good nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: kazzy006
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to locate, and in a very good area. Though if you arrive by train, as we did, then you do have what seems a long walk, especially when pulling a suitcase!! We arrived before check in, but we could leave our luggage while we went sightseeing. The staff are friendly, but not very forthcoming with information unless asked. Point in question was that we were unaware of handing in our keys when we went out, but this was pointed out to us on our return. The hotel is reasonably close to 2 train stations, Port Royal (RER) and Censier Daubenton (Metro), but they are a good 10 minute walk, not strolling!! I would definitely recommend getting a Paris Vistie card for your stay. We bought a 3 day pass for 20 euros and it was worth every penny. The hotel is within a good area of restaurants and cafes, so you can find something to suit any taste. The breakfast was included in our price, and it was filling, but I don't think I would pay the 12 Euros to eat there, I would go to a local cafe. The rooms are of a good size, but the bed was awful, I have never had such a bad nights sleep. It is a very thin mattress on a hard bit of wood, not far off the floor. Apart from that the room was good, a little warm, but clean. The shower was ace, you could move the height, it was powerful enough and got hot very quickly. If I went back to Paris, I would probably find another hotel, though would recommend if going for a couple of nights as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: PetalPusher63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tired but very clean, but would sufice nicely to a traveller that is looking not to be in the middle of the tourist district. As many hotels, it's rooms are small, but the architecture is very interesting, especially in the breakfast room .It is very nicely located near public transport and within a 10 minute walk of the train. It is just minutes by foot to the Rue Mofftard, which would fufill all the needs of a traveller nice selection of eateries ( too many to count) at a responable price and a bit of shopping. It has a wonder patissiere on the corner and when you open the windows of your room in the morning you can smell the fresh pastry baking. The area is very safe and I travelled on foot in the evening alone and felt very safe. This is not a luxury hotel, but for those that are in Paris to see the sights and be out and about it's a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and well-located.”
Reviews.Author: TheJeppos
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant place to stay, being within easy walking distance to notable tourist icons such as Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Luxembourg Gardens and also the metro. the room was a tad small, and the bed fairly average, but the bathroom was fine. The service personnel were all friendly and extremely helpful, and a very good daily breakfast downstairs in a quaint cellar, was a real highlight.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Holiday”
Reviews.Author: PembrokeshireOldhand
Reviews.Content: I took my 2 grandchildren to show them Paris. We flew FlyBE from Manchester. The holiday was organised by letsgo2 and I can highly recommend them. Beware of luggage on FlyBE. Only cabin luggage - hold cases charged Â£13 each way! I cannot praise the Serotel Lutece highly enough. Staff were first class. The breakfast is the best I have ever had in a French hotel. Being on my own with 2 young children we were given a suite of 2 connecting rooms. The bathrooms are small, but all Paris bathrooms are small. The hotel is in a quiet area near the Jardin du Luxembourg. Censier Daubenton Metro and Port Royal RER are within a short walking distance. We bought Paris Visite travel cards and used them on RER, Metro, buses and funicular - excellent value. The highlight for me was dining in the Jules Verne restaurant on the Eiffel Tower. For my grandson it was the trip down the Paris Sewers! Vive Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jlmIllinois
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 days this year and it was a really nice experience. The reviews are not kidding when they say to rooms are small bust alot of European hotels are. I was not there to sit in my room anyway and was just in there literally to sleep. I loved the area that the hotel is in. A ton of great restaurants right there and a charming area of town. The staff was very helpful with booking tickets etc and spoke English very well. We sat outside in the courtyard almost every night and enjoyed some fabulous French wine that we purchased and one of the great wine shops about a block away. I would recommend this but I would agree, there is no storage what so ever for luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: RhSh
Reviews.Content: The Serotel Lutece really is a mixed bag. We booked the hotel for a 5 nights stay in December for 352 GBP which is really cheap for Paris so we expected a budget hotel. So why is the hotel a good choice? Well, the service is really nice (friendly staff, more than ok English), clean rooms and good shower. For a continental breakfast, the hotel's is nothing less than superb with a good choice of cereals, cold meats, cheese, breads, rolls and various sweet pastries. Also, there's a brilliant pattiserie just near the hotel which you'll spend a lot of money in and it's worth every cent. So why not choose this hotel? Well, the room, while clean, is tiny! We travelled light so managed but I have no idea how you can fit a suitcase there and there's hardly a storage facility in the room. Also, the hotel is quite dated and the room is not really inspiring. The fact that all the relevant metro stations are at least 10 minutes' walk from the hotel could also be a consideration although there's a bus stop that can take to a close proximity of most of Paris' attraction just outside the hotel. In regards to location, this is really a question of personal preferences. We loved the fact that we were in a quiet, half residential area off the beaten track yet still 10 minutes walk from Luxemburg or the Pantheon and just 2 minutes walk from the wonderful Rue Muffetard with its food market in the morning and lively restaurant scene in the evening but it is by no means central. Would we be back? To the area - definitely. To the hotel - possibly. There's nothing really bad to say about it which in itself is quite an achievement in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest hotel rooms ever”
Reviews.Author: TillyWales
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews saying the rooms were small but I had no idea we were talking Harry Potter cupboard under stairs small. Our double room was so small we could touch the walls while lying in bed on three sides of the room. There was inadequate cupboard space to hang clothes and the safe in the room carries an 11 euros charge per stay. If you opened the bathroom door you couldn't walk to one side of the bed or the only cupboard/wardrobe in the room. The bathroom was oddly designed with empty space at one end and a large basin but the toilet was jammed up against the shower. Luckily I am a slender person because you cannot stand sideways in the shower with your arms at your sides without turning the shower control off. The other problem is the shower door opens inwards so you have to squeeze yourself into the corner of the shower to get out of it. If you are a larger person god knows how you would get in or out of the thing. When we complained about the size of the room we were told that all standard double rooms were the same size. The staff were friendly but used to the same complaint it seems. Breakfast is buffet style and adequate but not fabulous. On our first day we were out on the streets of Paris by 9am and returned footsore and tired some 6 hours later to find our room not serviced. We did it ourselves and put the do not disturb sign up to rest only to be first telephoned and then have the staff knock on the door at 4pm to ask if we wanted it done regardless on the DND sign on the door!! The next day we asked them to do our room in the morning and to be fair they did so. The television broke down on a daily basis which was annoying when we wanted some down time and to catch up on the news. All in all a terrible experience which left us feeling imprisoned in a cell rather than staying in a hotel. I wouldn't return to this hotel as there are a lot better places to stay in Paris than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: Steph V
Reviews.Content: If I was on a budget I would stay at Serotel Lutece again because it was quite clean and the staff was very friendly. The rooms are SO SMALL I was shocked...rooms that end in 04 seem to be the largest according to the fire escape diagram (we were in 107). I liked being close to rue Mouffetard and the neighborhood is very quiet. If you want more action this is not the place for you. If you have a bigger budget stay somewhere closer to St-Michel or Saint-Germain. The Good: - VERY clean - Nice walk to the Metro - Nice staff - Cheap internet access and bar drinks - Quiet neighborhood - Good water pressure in the shower - Boulangerie next door - Close to Mouffetard - Window that opened to the courtyard The Bad: - Longish walk to Metro (but OK if you cut through Mouffetard and stop at a cafe or two) - Smallest room I've ever stayed in - No place in room to store luggage - Tiny bathroom...could not get to the toilet if the door was open - Very minimal space for clothes...small dresser and closet - Bathroom floor got soaked every time we took a shower thanks to the weird shower "door" which was a narrow glass panel - Dated room needs updating (wallpaper, carpet, bed spreads, lamps) - Super hard, uncomfortable beds with old blankets - Substandard toiletries / soap - Charge to use the in-room safe - Small TV

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location as a base for travelling + close to Metro and RER stations”
Reviews.Author: Connell M
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights mid-week. Situated near hospital but you wouldn't know it. Nide area with market area as well as shops and patisseries nearby. Walking distance to Lux Gardens and Pantheon, but easy to hop on Metro for further travlelling Had a small-ish double room located at back of property on ground floor which was comfortable and quiet. Only strange thing was the long tubular bolster pillow, but normal pillows were also available to changeout. Friendly staff at check-in and breakfast, etc. Allowed to store bags before check-n and after check-out as had late Eurostar departure Interesting stone cellar for great continental breakfasts

Reviews.Title: “Find a different place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ILUVPARIS2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with my parents stayed here in September 2008. As the Pope was visiting Paris later that week, our normal choice of hotels was very limited. Most were booked up. This was really a last resort as we needed to be in Paris that week to make other connections. The two room apartment we had was not at all value for the money. We were charged 290 euros while the booking and their website (still) shows the rate of 250 euros. This was an overpriced stay and not good value whatsoever. There was really nowhere to even make a sandwich. The beds were uncomfortable and the standard room size was ok, but not much storage space. The bathroom however was very clean with an abundance of towels. Breakfast was not worth the money either at 12 euros, but this appears to be a hotel standards. My parents only ate there once in the 3 days. Hotel staff were not pleasant and difficulties getting a taxi ordered from the hotel almost caused us to miss a connection. Overall I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and boring”
Reviews.Author: deep_in_france
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few hotels in Paris and some other Best Westerns. This hotel was a real dated thing. The rooms were the normal Parisan size but my impression of the room was it was so dated. Yes it was clean enough and the staff were helpful (I speak French so I don't know if their English is up-to-scratch). I didn't do breakfast as I checked out early - but then I never do 'overpriced' hotel breakfasts when I can go to a cafe. Overall just okay but there are much better B/Ws in Paris. I also though it was expensive compared to others I have stayed in. My overall opinion then is to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, good value--great experience”
Reviews.Author: basteca
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in Paris staying at the Serotel Lutce and I was thoroughly satisfied with the hotel overall. The breakfast is excellent, as other travelers have mentionedâ€”it really gave us energy for our all-day treks. I didnâ€™t appreciate the value of the ample included breakfast until I realized that a similar one at a local cafÃ© would cost about â‚¬14 and the portions would be much smaller. Our room (504) was quite small but no different from any other European hotel I have stayed inâ€”European hotel rooms are tiny, thereâ€™s little way to get around it without paying through the nose! Other rooms on our floor seemed bigger on the layout, so I imagine it was just our luck to get the smallest. The shower was indeed tiny but the mattress was comfortable and we had a very large window that opened into the beautiful courtyard to let in fresh air when we were feeling claustrophobic. We felt like we were in a VERY safe area. We were not worried about coming in late at night and the streets were so silent we slept undisturbed. Not much night-life nearby, for better or worse. Every morning on the short walk to the RER station at Port-Royale we walked through a real Parisian street market which is an experience youâ€™d definitely miss out on by staying in a more â€œtouristyâ€� area. We found the staff very friendly and helpful but didnâ€™t need to use their concierge services. We used the safe for free (the â€œred buttonâ€� is inside the door by the hinge to reset the code) and while the fabric on the walls was a strange choice, our room was not smelly and we didnâ€™t see any mold as other travelers have mentioned. It really was no different than you would expect in a three-star hotel in the States. We also had an alarm clock and a hairdryer which was a plus. Overall, the hotel was small, but clean and safe. I would definitely recommend it to a traveler on a budget, especially for students. If youâ€™re coming to Paris to watch American TV, you should probably just stay homeâ€”at night, there was a news channel and BBC World in English, but we were so exhausted that our room served its purpose as place to crash. However, I would not recommend this hotel to a travel with limited mobility: the rooms were too small to be wheelchair accessible and at times, the small elevator was tied up by staff use. To sum it all up: Clean, safe, great location. Our amazing trip to Paris was possible because of the great sleep we got at the Serotel Lutece.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: chichobbit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really nice location on the Left Bank, about ten minutes' walk from two metro stations, Censier-Daubenton (M7) and Port Royal (an RER line, which also has direct service to Charles de Gaulle airport, a big plus). There are a couple of open-air markets nearby including one on Rue des Patriarches that has great fresh fruit and meats. It's also very close to the Luxembourg Gardens, which are beautiful. Most importantly, the neighborhood is fairly quiet and we felt quite safe, even walking back to the hotel at two in the morning. The room is rather small - it was not easy to get ourself and the luggage past the door because of the bed's awkward location - but the room we stayed in had a great bathroom, much larger than the typical closet-sized European bath. The shower had a removable massage showerhead and the room was well-lit. There is a mini-bar in the room which we used as a refrigerator to store cheese and meat in to keep costs low. The breakfast, included in the rate, is really very good especially by European standards and includes a variety of meats, cheeses, yogurts, cereal, fruits, bread, and eggs plus juice and coffee. We filled up at breakfast and were easily satisfied till a late lunch. There is a TV in the room, but it only had four channels and let's face it, if you are in Paris you're probably not there to watch television! Wi-Fi is available for a fee, but if you have a laptop there are plenty of cafes in Paris which offer free service. The hotel also has a cute little courtyard in back, which was a nice place to relax with a glass of wine in the evenings. Everything was very clean and neat, and the staff were very helpful and cheerful. We arrived a few hours early for check-in but the staff stored our luggage so that we could go sight-seeing without having to worry about it. The one thing that was a little inconvenient was that the elevator went out on the first day we were there and was not fixed for our three-day stay, so we had to walk up to our room on the third floor (actually the fourth; Europeans number the ground floor 0) with our luggage, and there were a LOT of stairs. However, this is fairly standard for Europe. All in all I would definitely stay here again and strongly recommend it for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “It's All about the Glass..”
Reviews.Author: winddoggy
Reviews.Content: Really, this is a perfect hotel to answer the question: is the glass half full or half empty? For my friend and I the glass was certainly three quarters full. Seriously, though the wall paper may have sagged a bit, and the "up-datedness" of the facilities could be challenged, and our room was quite small, this little hotel was perfect for us. You just have to let yourslef be positive, willing to comprimise, and happy to be in a perfect location to experience the wonder that is Paris. Let's start with location: no walk of any signifiance to the Metro. Our first evening wander led us to Notre Dame in 20 minutes -- without any real directions. Rue Moffetard, close by, is a remarakbley convient, Parisian, and romantic street. THE STAFF WAS EXCEPTIONALLY KIND, INSIGHTFUL, AND EXPEDEINT -- I COULD NOT COMMEND THEM ENOUGH. Those who say otherwise simply have exagerated expectations. Also true for the breakfast -- really folks, the breakfast was excessively wonderful. I loved my six days in Paris, and this hotel played a significant role in my pleasure. Bravo. And MERCI.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Value for money”
Reviews.Author: glyncookson
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in October 07 and cannot fault this value for money hotel. Clean, well run, good location and more than adequete breakfasts. Would certainly stay there again Glyn Cookson Stourbridge UK

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, very handy for rue Mouffetard/Latin Quarter restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Tassarooni
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days/2 nights in Paris at BW Serotel Lutece. Location is about 1/2 km from Censier-Daubenton Metro, and the same from Port Royal. Location is perfect to go to the restaurants in rue Mouffetard/Rue de Pot de Fer area. Room (303 - twin) wasn't huge, but OK for two twin beds. This one faced the street. Not too noisy at night - just the occasional car. Bathroom small but clean and excellent water pressure in the shower (one of my measures of decent hotel rooms!) Breakfast is in a cellar(!) - exposed stonework gives it character. Plenty of choice in the buffet. Staff all very nice and helpful. No major issues apart from more accessible (and numerous) sockets probably needed in the room and maybe it is showing a little wear and tear. Great spiral staircase is alternative to using the shoebox lift to upper floors. There is a courtyard for the smokers, however lots of scaffolding during our visit. Would be willing to use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable nights, not very close to Metro.”
Reviews.Author: fifiHampshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. We had room 606, a lovely room in the eaves, with 2 separate sleeping areas, a single bed in each...nice and private.Excellent, firm mattresses, an added bonus. Good ensuite shower room. Breakfast was ample, in the cellar, though it could get a bit cramped if you breakfasted at a popular time. Open from 7am till 10.30am, so plenty scope. The rear of the building was covered in scaffolding, though no mention was made of this by reception staff upon our arrival, on the Friday evening. To be fair, we only heard the builders on Monday and Tuesday, our 2 last days, and they didn't start work excessively early. The room instructions stated that you could get a code for the room safe, for 11 Euros......huh, I made up my own code, for free! Well worth a go, though maybe the first couple of attempts, with the safe empty, just in case! Not the most central of hotels, but we had lovely quiet nights here, away from the bustle... Good Italian restaurant, just a bit further up Rue Claude Bertand...was very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Pokey rooms, not ensuite! Rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: MCHPTRUSH
Reviews.Content: We were told that we had a suite! Reality was more depressing. 2 very small smelly rooms, wardrobe in one room only and then the door dragged on the carpet. The one TV had abismal reception, second room had no TV. Reception staff were rude and argumentative. We only had breakfast on one day as it wasnt worth it and local Cafe's were much better. We booked through activehotels.com as they had given it a reasonable score.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed with a student travel group”
Reviews.Author: Madame44
Reviews.Content: I was the leader of a group of 31 students and adults traveling to Paris for one week. This was my first stay at thishotel. I saw approximately 15 of the rooms in this hotel. When we arrived, only several rooms were ready. There was some confusion in the room breakdown since we needed multiple rooms for our group. The main desk was helpful and responsive to our issues. Several people in my group needed to stay at a nearby hotel until rooms became available. The rooms here vary in size from VERY small (6' x8'--some referred to these rooms as "coffins") to the average European size (15' x 10'). There was one room--this may be the "apartment" that the hotel website refers to--which had two rooms with a shower. This room was great--plenty of space and very quaint. Not all rooms have a clock in them--some rooms have a very small shower (2Â½' x 3') others have a tub with a hand-held shower head. Most rooms have a blowdryer in the bathroom. The toilet is in a small separate room from the shower and sink. The walls in the rooms were covered in fabric--not wallpaper; therefore, some walls had a black substance on them which we believe was mold. This was not present in all rooms. There is a safe in most rooms for 11â‚¬ per week. The breakfast in the cellar was good--croissants, bread, cereal, yogurt, fruit, cold cuts, coffee, tea, hot chocolate and fruit juices. There is also complimentary coffee and tea in the rooms. The hotel location is good. The walk to the nearest RER station is approximately a 5-10 minute walk; the metro is slightly closer and passes through more quaint streets like the rue Mouffetard. There are supermarkets, cafÃ©s and a post office nearby. I went to school in France for a year in the 1980s and have stayed at multiple hotels in the Latin Quarter--I prefer this area as it is lively and reasonably priced. This hotel was very average for the area. Would I stay at this hotel with my family? No, I would not. It was reasonably priced, but the mold on the walls and the size of the rooms and shower stall would deter me. I am not a larger person (5'4" and not overweight) and I was squished in the shower stall. My 6'6" husband would NEVER fit into the shower stall. There are other hotels (check the rue du Sommerard), within the same price range which offer more breathing room. As I told my students before this trip--you are in Paris-one of the most beautiful cities in the world--have FUN and enjoy it. You will only spend limited time in the hotel. The French love their city and country and are very proud--if you have a complaint, voice it politely. If you already have reservations at this hotel--don't panic--it will be fine. Request the apartment on the 6th floor--or a room facing the street for a nice view. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and Clean”
Reviews.Author: macDublin
Reviews.Content: Family trip ( including a 3 year old ).Read reviews on this site and I must say I was a little hesitant. However, as most reviews point out the rooms are on the small side, but they were very clean and comfortable. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included and very ample. The hotel location is on the periphery of the latin quarter and is therefore a little quiet. The Metro ( Censier) is a 10 min walk through the vibrant food market. Notre Dame Cathederal is a good 30 min walk. The Pantheon is a 10 min walk. There are some restaurants cafes and food shops nearby. Overall a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad little hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: The_Scallans
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in a very good location for both walking and public transport. Staff polite; Good plentiful breakfast. Small room, very clean .. no english speaking channel on the TV but in Paris you shouldn't really be watching TV anyway! A bit disappointed at lack of email contact from hotel - I tried twice to obtain some info on airport shuttle but to no avail so sorted online myself. Very good restaurant next door!

Reviews.Title: “Rabbit warren of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: loxmif
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this rabbit warren from Nov 19. Recommended by Flight Centre Regent St UK as part of Eurostar package. Varying reviews on this site so we decided to give it a go and regretted it. Best Western skimps on as much as possible. Heating seems to be thermostat limited and at best is lukewarm. It is cold in Paris at this time of year. Request to supply some auxiliary heating came up negative. Only solution was extra blanketsX3. Carpets threadbare. Furniture tired. Linen not changed. Bed covers stained. Room cleanliness not great. Lighting in corridors on time switch. Corridors not heated. Supposed to have 3 English cable channels, but not available. You get some English speaking programmes occasionally on one channel shared, with other languages. Breakfast included in our tariff but very basic continental style-a few cold cuts, cereal, yogurt and breads. Lobby can be smoke filled especially when reception staff start chain smoking on the job. Reception staff variable in attitude. We did not look forward to returning to our "cell" at the end of the day. Location fair (see other posted reviews) but if you have an alternative, take it.

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel - great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Waterbabie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just got back from an amazing weekend in France. We had a Flight centre representative recommend this hotel as part of a Eurostar package deal. What I didn't realize is that this was a Best Western. I was hoping to have a boutique hotel so you can imagine my suprise when I realized it was part of an American chain. Overall the hotel was well kept. Nothing fancy. The staff were always pleasant and helpful and as we were not due to return to London until 8pm we were able to leave our bags for the day (after checkout) at the baggage locker by the reception. Our room was small but we had been warned that most hotel rooms in Paris are small. It was clean and tidy but definitely nothing special. We had a window that opened out to the courtyard. As its November I'd hope that they would make the most of this cute space in the warmer months. Right now it just looks a bit dreary. The buffet breakfast was great and you take your breakfast in the basement in this neat converted cellar. There was an assortment of cereals, croissants, bread, yogurt, cold cuts (a bit strange but tasty!), apple sauce and fruit. Overall its a decent hotel for the price we paid for it. If you're looking for luxury try somewhere else but if you're looking for something a bit more budget and in the fantastic Latin quarter this is a decent place.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing and shabby”
Reviews.Author: dulcieb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October because of the good reviews on tripadvisor and the photos of the hotel on its website. We were really looking forward to our Paris stay but the hotel was so disappointing we really hated going back to it after exploring Paris during the days. First the good things. The location is ok. It is really on the outer edge of the latin quarter so about a 25 minute walk to the Seine River and about a 10 min walk to the tube. We had a triple room with a balcony overlooking the street which was a plus, but to open the window you had to move the furniture. The room had a bath tub which is a bit plus for me. But the room was drab and shabby. The colour scheme was really weird, with red carpet, orange walls and a blue bedspread and the door jams were once cream but are now yellowed from age or nicotine. The carpet on the main staircase still has the remnants of someone's vomit on them which was obviously never cleaned. We were supposed to have tea and coffee making but were only supplied with instant decaff and when I asked the woman at the desk for regular coffee she had me running downstairs and back twice to get some instant coffee satchels from the breakfast room staff instead of organising some for me. You had to pay through the nose for everything in the hotel, including the use of the safe in the room, the internet connection and at check out they tried to charge me for breakfasts which we didn't have. I suggest you try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel in safe area”
Reviews.Author: Muffin_Mc_Garvey
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute trip to Paris in January and were advised to go to the Latin Quarter. This hotel was recommended to us and we eventually found it!1 its a bit of a treck in heels from the metro but in a lovely area - definately go and see the food markets - there fantastic. On arrival the receptionist was vv rude and didn't show us where elevator was so (being greenhorns) we dragged out bags up to the fourth floor!! Thankfully later we met a lovely night porter who showed us around properly (not really much to show except lift and how to get to basement for breakfast). The rooms were clean and going by other reviews our bathroom was hugh (for paris). Lovely breakfast - Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Much Better Elsewhere - Rundown & Filthy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: facchino
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm not the type of traveller who bashes all of the hotels I stay at - see my recent reviews of Hotel La Demeure in Paris & Exclusive Hotel Suisse in Nice. However, due to an online booking error for our honeymoon - I had to scramble for a hotel room the last night in Paris and we ended up at the Serotel Lutece. Walking into the lobby we instantly got the feel of a hotel that was run by employees working for some distant entity - lacking the pride and direct accountability of a family run hotel. When we went up to our floor on the elevator, the corridor was pitch black and we had to somehow feel our way to our room and unlock the door. Once we entered the room, we felt immediate disgust and disappointment. I looked down at the dark red rug and saw what looked like oil stains - who knows what they really were. I laid down to rest on the bed after a full day of travelling to Paris and felt a greasy bed comforter on my skin. My wife and I felt disgusted at the thought of sleeping in the bed with those sheets touching us - not ideal for the last night of our honeymoon. I lived in Europe for 2 1/2 years, so I know the showers can be small - but for the price of the hotel - they were unacceptably small. However, we were still in Paris so we went out and made the best of the evening. The kicker to our stay was that although we stayed at three other hotels throughout France which were all much nicer, the Serotel Lutece was the most expensive. And finally, when they called us a cab to the airport which they estimated at 60 euros - the driver showed up in an unmarked, unmetered car and charged us 100 euro upon arrival at Charles De Gaulle airport. Oh well, I guess getting ripped off is a part of life - just make sure it doesn't happen to you - AVOID BEST WESTERN SEROTEL LUTECE.

Reviews.Title: “A good litle hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Situated in a quiet suburb of Paris (5eme arrondissement). Our room was small (on the 6th floor) but comfortable and clean. The bathroom facilities were excellent. The hotel lobby / lounge / bar areas were all welcoming. clean and with a good standard of decoration. Staff were very friendly and helpful - all English speakers Breakfast was served in the basement. A good with selection of breads / pastries / cereals etc Location is 5 minutes walk from 2 metro stations and 10 minutes from and RER station with a direct line to the Gare du Nord (Eurostar Terminal) 5 minutes walk from Rue Mouffetard which has a lot good quality value for money restaurants Recommended

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore Paris in a nice quieter area”
Reviews.Author: EuroJustin
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a 3 day weekend to Paris (April 2006), staying at the great Best Western Serotel Lutece. We left it a bit late to book, so most of the hotels in Paris were more expensive than we had hoped. The three of us decided to share a room to try and cut costs, and this was one of the few hotels we found that had a double and single bed in the same room. The reviews on this site said the hotel was good, so we booked it and werenâ€™t disappointed. Previously we had stayed in Montmartre (Moulin Rouge and Sacre Coeur), but decided this time to stay in a quieter area, and chose The Latin Quarter as we wanted an district that felt like locals lived there. As a consequence, some of the near-by shops and boulangeries were closed on the Sunday (not all), but the positives far out-weighed that. There were some great restaurants and markets on Rue Mouffetard, and it was nice to be away from all the tourists. The hotel was really good. The foyer was decorated in floor to ceiling marble, and the staff were very friendly and helpful (recommended a tour to Versailles and restaurants). We arrived at 1:00pm, and our room wasnâ€™t ready so we had to leave our luggage and come back after 2. This was a minor pain, but gave us an opportunity to explore the area. The room was a good size for Paris. We had a second floor room with windows that opened onto the street. There was very little noise, and we slept well both nights. The beds were a good size (tip â€“ the normal pillows are in the wardrobe). We had a bar fridge, and a decent sized television (around 8 French speaking channels, BBC World and German MTV). The bathroom also had a bath and stand-up shower, which is also good for Paris. We didnâ€™t try the breakfast, as the boulangeries and their croissants were just too tempting instead. There was a safe in the room, but it cost â‚¬11 to use. The hotel is easy to get to from Gar de Nord, just 4 stops on the RER (Metro), and is close to the Luxembourg Gardens, and a nice stroll to St Germain and Notre Dame and also to the restaurants and cinemas in Montparnasse. There were also busses to pretty much everywhere. I would recommend this hotel to others looking for a good base to explore Paris, in a nice quieter area away from the tourists. And for a two-star it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: GEGLondon
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is definitely its biggest advantage. It's about an 8 minute walk from the metro station Censier-Daubenton, and surrounded by plenty of cafes and restaurants. There is also the street market which seems to be on most evenings, and is particularly lively on the weekends. The choice of cheese, fruit & veg, wine and chocolate is fantastic and the atmosphere would be hard to beat. We had to drag ourselves away to go and see the other sights! The hotel itself however is quite tired, with dark corridors and a small old fashioned bedroom (we had a twin and the single bed seemed more suitable for a 3 yr old child). We also did not find the reception staff to be friendly or helpful, as other reviewers did. On the positive side, the room was clean and there was a balcony looking out onto the street which was great for people watching! As it was we left the hotel at 10am each day and did not return until midnight, but next time I would choose a hotel comfortable enough to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beautiful Hotel, In a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my family were staying in this Hotel for one night, in an apartment, as we are 5 (3 children). No need to say that usually Hotel rooms in Paris are very small. This aprtment offered a great deal, since it comprises 2 large rooms,both with windows to the small garden, and a a large bath room. The hotel location is quiet, even it is in the latin quarter. You will find a daily market nearby in Rue Mouftard. The reservation is easy (done in the last moment), since it is done via Best Western reservation center. The breakfast was much more then the usual 'Petit dÃ©jeuner ', and we paid for only two adults, children is free. In overall, I recommend this hotel, especially if you need more then one room as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great position & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate01
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel and were pleasantly surprised. It was in a great location, latin quarter, and within walking distance of the metro and a lovely food street. We had the apartment which was 2 seperate bedrooms, a hall and a bathroom. We have two small children so needed some extra space. The bedrooms were pleasant, clean and homey with some nice touches such as plenty of tea and coffee provided. The bathroom was really nice and the highlight for us. It was fully renovated, with a beautiful big bath, great water pressure and nice vanity space. The staff were always friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend it if anyone is worried about finding a decent hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAGAPTH
Reviews.Content: Small but beautiful hotel set in a superb neighbourhood with lots of restaurants, bars, markets within walking distance

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Serotel Lutece
HotelInfo.Address: 2 rue Berthollet | 5th Arr., 75005 Paris, France
